trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration integration with Druva | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration integration with Druva | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Druva with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Druva with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Druva.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Druva.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Druva single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Druva single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Druva will be able to single sign into the application at your Druva company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Druva will be able to single sign into the application at your Druva company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Druva
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Druva

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Druva.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Druva.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Druva.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Druva.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Druva, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Druva, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Druva</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Druva</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Druva with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Druva with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Your Druva application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Druva application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Token Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Token Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Active Directory portal, on the Druva application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Active Directory portal, on the Druva application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Druva page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Druva page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Druva Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Druva application (e.g.: "https://cloud.druva.com/home/”), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Druva Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Druva application (e.g.: "https://cloud.druva.com/home/”), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Druva page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Druva page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Druva company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Druva company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage \> Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage \> Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-On Settings dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-On Settings dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Singl Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Singl Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Druva dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the ID Provider Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Druva dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the ID Provider Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Druva dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the ID Provider Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Druva dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the ID Provider Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the ID Provider Certificate textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the ID Provider Certificate textbox

trans-unit.source: To open the Settings page, click Save.
trans-unit.target: To open the Settings page, click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Settings page, click Generate SSO Token.
trans-unit.target: On the Settings page, click Generate SSO Token.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-on Authentication Token dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-on Authentication Token dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SSO Token</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SSO Token</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Copy.
trans-unit.target: Click Copy.

trans-unit.source: Click Close.
trans-unit.target: Click Close.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: |Attribute Name|Attribute Value| |---|---| |insync\auth\token|<clipboard value>|
trans-unit.target: |Attribute Name|Attribute Value| |---|---| |insync\auth\token|<clipboard value>|

trans-unit.source: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Value textbox, type the attribute value shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Value textbox, type the attribute value shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply Changes.

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Druva, they must be provisioned into Druva.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Druva, they must be provisioned into Druva.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Druva, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Druva, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Druva company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Druva company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage \> Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage \> Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Create New.
trans-unit.target: Click Create New.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Create New User dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Create New User dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create NewUser</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create NewUser</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the email address and the name of a valid Azure Active Directory user account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the email address and the name of a valid Azure Active Directory user account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Create User.
trans-unit.target: Click Create User.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Druva user account creation tools or APIs provided by Druva to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Druva user account creation tools or APIs provided by Druva to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Druva **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Druva **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
